Capoeira is best known in Brazil.

Capoeira is being taught to former child soldiers as a way to integrate them back into society.

In a hot, dusty courtyard in Goma, about 50 teenage boys begin their daily practice.

Ombeni is a small, thin 15-year-old.
He's moving back and forth while kicking a leg up between chants.
He says he likes capoeira the way it's practiced here because it only simulates violence.

You only pretend.
